messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] science experiment help needed please?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Try entering stalagmite epsom salt into Google.com. (And the only polite reason to point out spelling is that stalactite will get you better results than
messages.messageBody:
on 2/15/02 12:09 AM, KimBaker at azhom@... wrote:

> Can anyone give me a "recipe" and directions on how to make stalagtites and
> stalagmites? I know it has epsom salt or baking soda or something. ha ha
> but I don't know how much? Please help

Try entering stalagmite epsom salt into Google.com. (And the only polite
reason to point out spelling is that stalactite will get you better results
than stalagtite ;-) You can remember it by c is for ceiling and g is for
ground.)

Here's the first few that popped up. There are many more.

Create your own formations:
http://www.caveofthewinds.com/test/formationsdir.html

http://www.google.com/search?q=cache:NAQHxMG664cC:www.omniplex.org/BBB_1Q01.
pdf+stalagmites+epsom+salt&hl=en
(It's down near the bottom)

Crystal page
http://freeweb.pdq.net/headstrong/crys.htm

Joyce

messages.messageBody:
Can anyone give me a "recipe" and directions on how to make stalagtites and
stalagmites? I know it has epsom salt or baking soda or something. ha ha
but I don't know how much? Please help

Kim
